intro: Conyza dichroa, commonly known as the two-colored weed, is an annual flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and milky sap. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in various habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are alternate, hairy, and have a distinctive two-colored appearance on the upper and lower surfaces. Conyza dichroa is known for its small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, contributing to its weed status in agricultural areas.
